title.narrative: Provision of protection and specialised protection assistance to drought affected populations (vulnerable IDPs and host communities) in Benadir, South West States and Mudug.

description.narrative: The key objective of this project is to provide life-saving protection assistance to drought-affected populations (vulnerable IDPs and host communities) in Benadir, the Southwest States, and Mudug. This UNHCR project provides; identification and profiling of extremely vulnerable persons, protection kits, improve targeted multi-sectoral referral and response mechanisms and provides information, psychological first aid, psychosocial counseling, and legal aid (ICLA) to address evictions related concerns. The project provides humanitarian assistance to 25,000 people, including 4,405 women, 4,060 men, 16,500 children, and 1,500 Persons with disabilities.
